Well first things first, this is some sort of a parody of the harem genre. Hence, not really be taken seriously.
Kanojo flag long name long name tells us about Hatate Sota who can see "flags". These "things" is quite powerful that it can change the fate of any person/ thing who has them. He cannot just see them, but also change the flag! For some reason, he meets up girls until it becomes a full blown harem! (Though this will be explained in the later part of the show.)
Story: 7-8
Come on, it's harem! So don't take it seriously! The show doesn't even hide it. 
Duringthe first episodes, it was very fast-paced. I mean, VERY FAST. Can't blame them for that since there's 9 girls in total. As for the ending, though they did explain the flag concept but it's pretty short? 

This could've been better if this series was 2- cour. Simlar of the koichoco anime, they built the tension perfectly, 

elections and etc. but when the ending came… Yeah. 


Characters: 6-7

They are stereotypes of their archtypes except for the Main character who is still generic harem MC# 44310. From cute girls who seems like boomboxing  when they run to make it sound quite cute to characters who's a Imouto(not blood related), A useless student council president, an idol,  a trap,  A loli who's an elder, A robot, A wannabe onee-san who's the same year as MC who always have a laddle for some reason, a forgettable self proclaimed best friend who only appeared in the first episode, you name it. Despite having the same feelings for the Main Character, they are somewhat charming since they are not violent and just lovable.


Art: 7

Art was not bad. Some people complain about the QUALITY faces, but that's not true at all. It's the character designer's fault, the animators has no idea to animate it. Look at the promo images. They look all derpy, but the anime is far from that.


Sound: 9

DAT JAZZY OPENING and that generic ending. Again, the opening is a parody of romance anime that you see during the 90's. Very nostalgic. The BGM was used very carefully for the different moods of the show.


Enjoyment: 7

It wasn't bad but it's not a masterpiece. If you want mindless fun with a huge pile of mood swings and girls! I'd recommend you to try this show. I mean this ain't White Album 2 or Toradora. 


For me, this was the dark horse of the Spring season. If you wanted bad harem, check out those with cute anime-like alien deformed mascots.

Staying awake after 2 PM, digging through an endless stream of "funny anime clips", I stumbled upon this weird video titled "Gaworare - The Trap"(yea I love traps shut up). So I gave this one a try and it was... good... I guess.
The concept really caught my eye. A young high school boy with PTSD with the power to see "flags"- which tells the person's emotions, fate, etc.
Follow his journey to create the most harem-y harem ever.
Characters are pretty basic, like you've seen them EVERYWHERE ELSE. Not special in anyway. But they don't have to be special to become enjoyable. I really like them, fortheir basic personalities. Because 13 episodes is nowhere enough to give the entire cast an in-depth character development .\n
Plot is... well... meh. The first part, nothing much happened. Just comedy/adding harem members. And at the end, the anime just have to take itself seriously and make the MC fights the illuminati with a Sony VR or something. It's rushed, hard to follow and not as enjoyable as the rest of the anime.\n
Overall, definitely recommended.

I would like to write: "HaHa" for about 20 lines of text and just be done with it but no... Let's look at it from different perspective. "KOGA" because i like to call this anime like that was... weird. But before we begin for real i'd like to say that i try to be as subjective as possible, i won't compare it to any other series with: better art, sound and storyline, no. We are here, and KOGA is the only anime existing so we'll be focusing on only KOGA and nothing that has no KOGA in it's name, ready? Let's begin. KOGA was weirdnot because of bizzare characters that are simple as a wooden plank. Come on! What could be simplier than a wooden plank? They were in fact very simple and not really interesting but THE STORY and not characters is the main flaw in this series, it tried to be deep at times, touching death, life was cool for me but everything played out wrong as expected. I tried to go into it but every time i was trying to feel for the characters they would just spoil the whole atmosphere with their awkwardness, you can't get into the story when the characters are sooo freaking stupid and awkward. I don't want to spoiler anything /if you're such a masochist to watch this -_-\ So we will jump to the next flaw. Art was not so bad but still meh,and  although i liked the serious moments when the light went a little darker adding a small amount of depth to the whole scenery i cannot say it was not thrown to trash because of stupidity of other characters. Art was okay but it looked like bootleg parody quality crap at some times saying in short. Third thing on the list is sound and sound was... Poor. Opening sucked, ending too. Background music never touched me and i think neither any one of those who watched it. At this moment i need to watch opening one more time because i forgot what song it was... ((*whisper* It's as bad as i remembered ;/*whisper*)) boring and i won't ever, EVER listen to it again in my life. Next thing, characters... *Takes glasses of and takes a deep breath* are dumb. We got so much stereotypes! God damn it, would they finally learn that quality and not amount matters?! Really, make me 2 good looking characters with interesting development and i will be more happy with that than 20 okay looking retards. Painful! Next... Enjoyement, actually? Let's say that what i say in begin still stands. "There is no other anime than KOGA." I liked it. I enjoyed those stupid, not even funny characters. No depth at all just pure stupid entertainment that leads to stupid situations. I watched it alone, coz that's how you should watch such anime. ALONE, without lights, in your basement. No life, just KOGA and that's basically all. *Laughs* I could live with anime like KOGA only, duh i would even become anime fan like right now. I liked it not for it's story, art, characters, sound or anything else. I liked it because it's anime. I like anime, you reading it probably do too. We all like anime and every new episode, every new idea, even if made only for money or other crap, i don't care! Anime is my life as for now and just like with games i want more, crappy, good, extremely interesting. Doesn't matter because every anime is great and i would recommend KOGA to everyone that is interested in the Harem-LEVEL ULTRA EXTREME! Do you like harem anime? This is like wet dream for you, go check it now you pervert! But jumping to our conclusion for this too long, not serious and absolutely not professional review. I enjoyed KOGA for it's charming, stupid characters and romance which i'am a great fan of. I watched not because i'm a masochist but i just don't believe people in most cases. I was curious what this anime can bring to my life and it brought something. That warm feeling and polite compassionate smile that crawled on my face every time something awkward happened, thus alot... whole time to be honest. I think if they would go in different direction with this anime everything would play out all right but even though it was not perfect... we should learn to love every series, for that they are and not for that they please us. It would be all :P Thank you for time you wasted here and not watching anime, baka.

Also, I didn't even skip the opening once. The ending was decent but good enough to end the anime on a good note and leave you smiling and wanting more.

Twelve beautiful girls get interested in his strange way of living, and they begin to live with him at the school dorm. Need I say more? All-in-one package, from best girl, tsundere, imouto, princess, onee-chan, idol,teacher, to childhood friend for all your needs.

Extremely comically funny. You would seriously laugh till you stomach hurts. Fanservice,PLOT, plot. Please watch, you would not regret!

It has been quite a ride with this anime and I believe that this is one of those very good anime that binds story progression with a good amount of comedy lest not forgetting the harem and fanservice, would watch again.

KANOJO GA FLAG WO ORARETARA TAKES ON A LITTLE TOO MUCH
With vibrant colours, light-hearted music, a bland male MC and a large cast of female characters, Kanojo ga Flag wo Oraretara, or Gaworare, met the important criteria for a generic, if not enjoyable, comedy/harem show. It would have stayed an average comedy/harem show if it hadn't tried to take on too much at once. This great aspiration led to a series of mixed results which I'll explain by exploring key aspects of the show.
-----------------------------------
Comedy or mystery or both?
-----------------------------------
On the surface, Gaworare was a simple show of random comedic events that revolved around Souta and hisever-expanding mob of 'supporters' even though the show started out with a somewhat dark event involving a 'death flag'. However, as the show progressed, there were hints to a plot but they often seemed unrelated to the episodes and weren't an emphasis of the show until its later parts. Because the show seemed like a comedy at its heart, I found it difficult to pay attention to those little hints, and got confused as I watched later episodes. I would have better appreciated the plot if the show was presented as a mystery instead of a comedy.


-------------------------------------

A premise that wasn't fully explored

-------------------------------------

Souta's ability to visualize flags was the key premise of the show and sparked my interest. Starting with the 'death flag', I was soon introduced to various other flags, like the 'friendship flag' and 'romance flag'. As the show progressed, more flags were introduced with some characters having their own flags. This eventually led to the flags having less influence on the characters. I would have preferred if the show focussed on a few flags and expanded on them.


---------------------------------

Large, average cast

---------------------------------

Like the average harem show, Gaworare had a large cast of female characters, most of whom were attracted to the MC for various reasons. Gaworare also did its best to make each member of the harem unique by providing backstories and differing character design; you could still tell which girl was which even if her outfit was switched with another girl's. Due to the length of the show, most of the characters aren't developed past their backstories, leaving only a few memorable characters. But it was often nice to see the large, colourful mob of supporters that followed the MC around.


-------------------------------

Always cheery

-------------------------------

Gaworare was full of colours: from the harem with hair of various hues to the multi-coloured skirts worn by most of the female cast and the often bright backgrounds. The art of the show always seemed to evoke a cheery mood, even in the more solemn moments. Also, it was difficult to take some of the characters seriously when most of them were baby-faced, especially the girls in the MC's harem.


The soundtracks and OP song were mellow which captured the light-hearted nature of the series. The voice acting was excellent save for the MC who was mostly bland.



Overall, I'd say Gaworare was an average show and would have been more enjoyable if it'd hadn't tried to involve too many subjects at once.

I'll be frank, this anime deserves 24 episodes, not 13. The simple fact that it only had 13 episodes made it bland. To be honest, I'm writing this after watching the anime and after reading the manga and a few portions of the Light Novel that I tried to read (hard to read when its not translated. Its either there's really no translation yet or I just suck at finding these translations). The manga had a lot more to show, and it gave you time to like each character. Each character in the series had their own development, this is true as well in theanime, but it was so pressed with time and the amount of episodes, it couldn't't deliver the amount of enjoyment it COULD have given.


The story is the same as both the Light novel and the manga, its goo, but as I've said, with only 13 episodes, what can you do so much with it? 24 episodes wouild have most definitely fixed this issue. The art was good, I noticed a few stale colors at times, the girls gicing off a very colorful look while leaving the main character the same would have been good since it relates to the plot, but overall the art was good, it was enjoyable. 


As for sound, the voice actors did a good job, the BGM was right on track. It fits each situation and can be quite amusing.


Character - this is where it gets problematic. Each character DOES have good development, don't worry. But the story is too rushed, it didn't really give you an opportunity to like the characters or feel attached to them. The main character is what saved the character portion of this, because Souta can be quite easy to relate to. He has a very "human" feel to him


Enjoymewnt - honestly, this would have been up to 9 had the show given me enough time to enjoy each character and situation. It rushed from one event to another. It was a good harem, but too much harem. It focused on the heroines as a whole, focusiong on the usual RomCom


Overall: Enjoyable. Good, but disappointing, I was expecting a lot more since I've been reading both he manga and Light Novel

Okay so the english name of the anime is 'What if her flag was toppled' Yes the anime contains a lot about various flags, this anime is not practically hugely interesting, but it is an eye catching anime, although there are low ratings for the anime, my rating would be 8/10, i will explain the reason for giving an 8/10 below 
The story is about a boy who has the ability to detect flag, Now you may all be thinking what are these flags? The flags are something like the current mood the person is facing for example showing love and affection would be displayedby a Love Flag on top of the persons head, Now the MC has the ability to see these flags and also he has the ability to change these flags, For example he can change a death flag to a love flag, This is merely called as changing fate. 


Now this anime has a lot of plot twists and may be confusing for a first timer, but the MC has inspired me about humans, The way each of us looks at the world and humanity may be different, but this anime shows how Humans can be really helpful even at times of misery they help each other. This was what inspired me the most, The MC also does everything despite him having a death flag on top of his head (Oops! Spoiler), Yes the MC has a death flag on his head, this is the point which makes the anime even more interesting, during the time i watched this anime i kept thinking what would be his next move, what would he do? This anime indeed did keep me in a state of suspicion all the time. Another thing would be that most people who love harem animes would definitely love to watch this anime 


As for the Art and sound of the anime, please watch it in 720P or 1080P to really enjoy the anime. There isn't much i can comment on this part though


The enjoyment i got through this anime was good, and i really liked it, though there may not be good ratings for the anime my rating is this, and it would be a good anime to watch when you are like out of options.

First of all, let me straight out say that I really didn't like this show at all. I thought that it was just a jumble of trashy cliches, and never really did anything at all. I thought that the show started out pretty well, it had a good unique concept that could really go to some great places as a romantic comedy, but it turned into a harem, a trashy harem at that.
Story: 2
As I stated earlier, the story started out well, it had a unique premise, but for some stupid reason the show could not decide if it wanted to be a romantic comedyor a dark story--which I should add made zero sense. The show couldn't help but through cliche after cliche at you with literally every type of girl  falling for the main character at the slightest hint of flirting. To make it worse the show makes it seem like it actually has a dark, thought intriguing plot, but really it's just a stupid side story that no one should have any interest in at all.


Art: 5

The art was pretty straight forward. It wasn't good or bad at all, and very occasionally it did manage to pull out a good sequence of animation, but overall, the art was just average. You can't really do anymore with a generic romantic comedy unless it has a high budget, which I am pretty sure it did not.


Sound: 6

The music in this show is really the only thing worth redeeming in it. The OP is extremely catchy and at times I found myself humming it to myself while I was walking around the house. The ED is also pretty catchy, not nearly as good as the OP, but still nice. However, the actual background music is bland and uninteresting, but I wasn't really expecting too much after this show disappointed me so quickly. Really the OP and ED are the only reasons that I am giving this show a higher score than I would have.


Character: 1

Oh boy, the characters. I could probably spend paragraphs ranting about the characters in this show, but I will try to be as brief as I can. The girls in this show are literally the blandest pieces of trash that I have ever watched. Seriously, I have watched my share of trashy romantic comedies, but this show might actually take the cake. The girls fall for the guy simply out of a single smooth words, and then they love him forever. Literal. Trash. I know that the show's plot has to do with seeing flags, and that that would probably explain the reason for why they fell for him so easily, but I cannot get past this stupid explanation for girls with literally zero character. However, while the girls are bland, the main character might be the worst character in this show. He is the most angst filled character I have watched in a while, literally picking up girls one after another and then leaving them behind in his harm to pick a random child lost on the street, another girls little sister, a girl he literally just met, and on and on. I cannot go into enough depth to express my hate for this character, so I will stop while I still hold onto some manner of manners. To end this section on a positive note, the trap was 10/10.


Enjoyment: 4

While this show was incredibly bad with it's more than fair share of plot holes and the such, as a romantic comedy it is only decently bad. At times it did make me laugh with a stupid situation. Really all I have to say at this part, was that my enjoyment of the show was just decent and that's the best I can say about it.


Overall: 3

This show is just a jumble of cliches, trashy story, terrible characters, and a good OP and ED. In fact, the OP and ED are the only reasons I am giving this show a 3, if they weren't good then I probably would have given this a 1. In the end, I really only finished this show so that I could review it to give it a bad review, but that's that. If anyone told me that they wanted to watch this show, I would tell them to only watch it unless you want to trash it with your friends. Other than that, don't watch this show if you value your time.

This is the most ridiculous anime I've ever seen. I'm not even joking. It's awful. I mean, the beggining was good, it had potential, but then they just decided to screw things up and it turned on that... thing.
You get what I'm saying during this review.
Story: 1
Where those guys wanted to go while writing the script? I mean, it was ok in the start: a normal Harem with a little of fantasy in it, kind of good actually, but then in the 11th episode they just decided: "let's make a REAAAAALLY weird and confusing story to end this!". Like, they just decided to put alot of things that could give us that good feeling of mistery in the start and did not thought how it would end. You see, it had plenty of potential, but many things were... confusing, at least. I did not expect for it to become that weird. 

Resuming, they just throw information in our heads in the last two/three episodes and expect us to understand the whole thing in 24 min.


Art: 6

Not bad, just... normal. It is not the most awful I've ever saw but it is not the best as well. Average.


Sound: 6

Average as well. The ed and the op weren't that good in my opinion and the seiyuu's work wasn't bad.


Character: 8

This is probably the best aspect of the whole story: good characters.

As I said before, it had lots of potential: the characters had a good personality and appearence, a backstory tragic enough for me to actually feel sorry for them and stuff like that, but they didn't know how to work with that.


Enjoyment: 6

I did not hated watching this anime, but I've seen lots of anime much better than this one. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't good as well. Actually, a waste of time, but the kind of waste we can learn from and avoid in the future.


Overall: 3 

I pay lots of attention to an anime story, and it is the thing that makes me most likely to recommend it to someone. This is a great representation of a story awfully constructed and I just got devastated with that finale. It was INCREDIBLY CONFUSING AND UNNECESSARY. IT HAD SO MANY BETTER WAYS TO END IT AND WHILE I WAS WATCHING I LITERALLY ASKED MYSELF: "Is the anime story too confusing or am I to dumb to understand it?" I CAN ASSURE YOU IT WAS THE FIRST OPTION.

I am just so shocked that this anime exists that I... I have no words to describe it. Just don't.

To be honest, this anime is technically not a bad harem anime. Well, Kanojo ga flag wo Oraretara is a nice anime but it lacks a lot of details and points. 
Story 8/10
The story sounds unique, which is great and it sounds very tragic since the male protagonist Hatate Souta is a mysterious character. I can't really spoil it. The story is at least one of those good points, and it got my attention because it wasn't boring. 
Art 7/10 
The animation is not bad and I give it some points since the animation is bright and the character design is not bad as well.It lost a lot of points because the animation at the last two episode did not do very well. (Trying not to spoil) The major problem is how they can actually pull off the really energetic scene when (again trying not to spoil) when a bunch of character is trying to help each other out and the main character gets a bunch of illusions which is good but at the tragic main scene, it gets messed up by a bunch of minor things happening. I mean "yeah the animation of the flag is kind of a bit funny because the way the flag pops up and breaks is a good comedic element.(correct me if I am wrong) 


Sound 7/10 


The sound is not bad, and the voices of each character matches them. I don't really pay attention to sound and voice because it is kind of hard for me to determine if their voice acting is good. For readers, have a perceptive mind when you read my judgement on the sound. I am not strong in determining good sound quality of characters. 


Character 5/10 


This is the part that really was bothering me. It lacks development, and character exposure. It is kind of a new term I probably use or made up but i am pretty sure other people use this term. Character exposure pretty much means how much did the character open up and how much did a person really express their true feelings or troubles. To be honest, a lot of characters lacks development and it annoys me a whole lot. First of all, I always have this major question "How did this and that lead to this route?" in harems because routes are important and it gives the viewer an understanding of what is happening. It lacks a lot in character development and exposure and it is hard to tell if this girl is apart of the harem. Another thing that was bothering me was the antagonists didn't get character exposure. It is so hard for me to tell if the antagonist is actually an antagonist or a good person.


Enjoyment 8/10 


It is enjoyable and I liked it a lot. Even though it lacks character development. I liked the main characters since they only focus on only three characters. The second main character has really made this anime enjoyable because Nanami has tsundere points over 9000 and she is in third place in tsundere charts. 1st is Louise from Familiar of Zero and second is Taiga from Toradora. 


Overall 6/10


I would give it a 6 because character development and character exposure is important and it makes up an anime and manga. I would give it a 6 until the OVA airs in December 2 and I will probably raise the score if they fix the character development and exposure.
